article_title: SUNY Orange seeks to boost enrollment
article_text: Sign up for our newsletter and have the top headlines from your community delivered right to your inbox.

article_metadata.description:
MIDDLETOWN – The way SUNY Orange President Kristine Young sees it, community colleges exist in an “opposite world” when it comes to the economy. When times are bad, enrollment is good; when the economy’s good, enrollment drops.
She thinks that theory explains the college's decline in enrollment since spring 2015. The combined total for the Middletown and Newburgh campuses is down to 4,969 from 5,139, a dip of 170 students, or a bit more than 3 percent. Compare that with
article_metadata.author: Richard J. Bayne
